action.content:
You are participating in a collaborative guessing game.
The goal is to find out whether this picture and another picture only I can see, are the same.
Please describe your image first. Then, I will provide my description and we can ask each other questions about the images to figure out whether they are the same. Each of us can ask 3 questions. Now start your short image description with "DESCRIPTION:" followed by the description. Do not add anything else.

DESCRIPTION: The image consists of several pixelated shapes in different colors on a white background. There are green, purple, pink, and orange shapes arranged in a seemingly random pattern. The shapes are blocky and resemble Tetris pieces.

You are participating in a collaborative guessing game.
The goal is to find out whether this picture and another picture only I can see, are the same.
Please describe your image first. Then, I will provide my description and we can ask each other questions about the images to figure out whether they are the same. Each of us can ask 3 questions. Now start your short image description with "DESCRIPTION:" followed by the description. Do not add anything else.
DESCRIPTION: The image contains several pixelated shapes on a white background. There is a purple cross shape, several green L-shaped figures, orange L-shaped figures, and pink T-shaped figures.

This is my DESCRIPTION: The image consists of several pixelated shapes in different colors on a white background. There are green, purple, pink, and orange shapes arranged in a seemingly random pattern. The shapes are blocky and resemble Tetris pieces.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my image that may be different to your image. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Are there any shapes in your image that are not L-shaped, T-shaped, or cross-shaped?

This is my DESCRIPTION: The image contains several pixelated shapes on a white background. There is a purple cross shape, several green L-shaped figures, orange L-shaped figures, and pink T-shaped figures.
QUESTION: Are there any shapes in your image that are not L-shaped, T-shaped, or cross-shaped? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my image that may be different to your image. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Are the shapes in your image arranged in a way that they are touching or overlapping each other?

ANSWER: No
QUESTION: Are the shapes in your image arranged in a way that they are touching or overlapping each other? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my image that may be different to your image. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Is there more than one shape of each color in your image?

ANSWER: No
QUESTION: Is there more than one shape of each color in your image? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my image that may be different to your image. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Are the shapes in your image evenly distributed across the white background?

ANSWER: Yes
QUESTION: Are the shapes in your image evenly distributed across the white background? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my image that may be different to your image. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Is there a purple cross shape in the top left area of your image?

ANSWER: Yes
QUESTION: Is there a purple cross shape in the top left area of your image? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my image that may be different to your image. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Is there a pink T-shaped figure in the top right area of your image?

ANSWER: Yes
QUESTION: Is there a pink T-shaped figure in the top right area of your image? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.

Now come to a decision. What do you think: are your picture and the other picture described the same picture?  Write "DECISION: same image" if you think they are the same picture or "DECISION: different images" if you think they are different pictures. Do not add anything else.
